column4: I'm trying to use gnome classic but the Unity bar keeps coming up unless I log into Gnome classic No Effects
All the sources on the internet state that I shouldnt have a problem. well more of they dont provide a solution because my problem is unique XD
Is it safe to uninstall unity altogether on ubuntu 12.04?
I believe your in the wrong channel for that though my friend
heh apt-get install kde... or lubuntu and not select it
I dont want KDE or LXDE
I have gnome-panel installed. I get the correct gnome classic as it looks in ubuntu 10.04. However the Unity bar ALSO appears
every guide and video online shows that the unity bar doesnt appear but it does on my computer
classic gnome is up and running but Unity overlaps it. I have unity on top of my peanut butter
I have watched 6 videos on youtube and they all show that unity wont come up on 12. but on mine it does
thats what Im asking :). if its safe to uninstall unity on 12. or if its critical to the desktop build
try uninstalling it... it will tell you what packages it will break if any
